description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by the cataloger. 20 lines per page. Written in very small naskh in black ink with use of red. Text on ff. 1b and 2a within a gold leaf frame outlined in black ink. Foliation in pencil in Western numerals. Catchwords on the verso of each leaf. Glazed European paper (a few sheets are a later replacement on a different paper). Ownership seal on fol. 114a.
author: Jāmī, 1414-1492
abstract: Jāmī's Durrah al-fākhirah, a treatise verifying the doctrines of the Sūfīs in comparison with theologians and philosophers, written at the request of Sultan Mehmed II, and his Tafsīr al-Qurʼān, which was not completed and is in fact a commentary on the Sūrat al-Fātiḥah and the beginning of the Sūrat al-Baqarah (up to 2:40).
extent: 114 leaves : paper ; 155 x 107 (125 x 75) mm. bound to 162 x 110 mm.
title: Durrah al-fākhirah wa-Tafsīr al-Qurʼān
provenance: Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.
creator: جامي.
subject: Qurʼan—Commentaries—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Brown leather with gold tooled guilloche and fillets around the borders, and blind tooled mandorlas painted in gold in the centre of upper and lower covers. Spine repaired in green buckram.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
